article.description: David West scored 10 of his 25 points in overtime as the 11th-ranked Musketeers stretched their winning streak to 14 games with an 88-80 victory over Saint Joseph's in a battle of Atlantic 10 Conference division leaders.
article.headline: West marks the spot with his OT heroics
article.linkText: Xavier survives OT, St. Joe's for 14th straight win
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Xavier is getting used to final-minute heroics. David West scored 10 of his 25 points in overtime, and Dedrick Finn also had seven in the extra period, leading the 11th-ranked Musketeers to their 14th straight victory, 88-80 over Saint Joseph's on Wednesday night. It was the fourth straight game in which the Musketeers (23-4, 14-1 Atlantic 10) needed a big shot in the final seconds of regulation. Lionel Chalmers hit a turnaround jumper with 7 seconds left to send this one into overtime. Xavier had won two of its last three games in the final seconds, and needed a tip-in at the buzzer to set up a two-point overtime victory against lowly Duquesne last Wednesday. The Musketeers haven't lost since Richmond beat them 67-59 on Jan. 7. "We agreed that toughing these games out and winning on the road will make us better later,'' West said. "Being able to pull these games out will only help us.'' Jameer Nelson scored 33 points and Tyrone Barley added 14 for Saint Joseph's (21-5, 11-4). It was the first home loss of the season for the Hawks, who had won three straight and seven of eight overall. "That's two quality teams out there,'' Saint Joseph's coach Phil Martelli said. "Everybody on our team contributed and we got maximum effort.'' Xavier took a 78-76 lead on a 10-footer by West with 1:35 left in overtime. He made a short jumper after a nifty spin move to make it 80-76. Two free throws by Barley cut it to 80-78, but Finn answered with two free throws. After Nelson missed a jumper, West got the rebound and made a free throw. Nelson's driving layup cut it to 83-80, but Finn made two free throws to ice it with 15 seconds left. The Hawks' fans threw towels and at least one bottle onto the court in the final seconds, drawing a technical foul. "I knew we were in trouble when our bus pulled up and they told us we had to go in from the back door,'' Xavier coach Thad Matta said, joking. The Hawks were without leading scorer Delonte West, out with a foot injury. West, averaging 18.5 points per game, missed one game with a stress fracture in his right foot, but returned to play two games before reinjuring his foot last Saturday. With West sidelined, Nelson assumed the scoring duties for Saint Joseph's. Though he started at point guard, Nelson played off the ball most of the game, and finished 13-of-34 from the field, including 6-of-15 from 3-point range. "I don't think I ever took 34 shots in a practice, but I did what I had to do,'' Nelson said. "I was a little fatigued in the second half, but this was a big-time game. I didn't want to let my team down.'' Finn had 18 points, Anthony Myles added 17 and Chalmers finished with 13. West had 14 rebounds. Saint Joseph's, which trailed by 14 points midway through the second half, took a 67-65 lead on a driving layup by Nelson with 2:20 left. Nelson's 17-footer and two free throws by John Bryant made it 71-67 lead with 39 seconds left. But West cut it to 71-69 on a pull-up jumper and Chalmers hit his shot after Saint Joseph's freshman Chet Stachitas missed the first of a 1-and-1 with 21 seconds remaining. Saint Joseph's had a chance to win it in regulation, but Nelson lost his dribble then missed a desperation shot from halfcourt at the buzzer. "It's a real tough place to play,'' said Romain Sato, who was held to 10 points for Xavier. "They play hard and it seems there are fans everywhere.'' Xavier took a 58-54 lead following a 13-2 run early in the second half. But the Hawks scored 10 straight to get right back in it. Nelson hit a 3-pointer, ending a scoring drought of 5:53. Then he added an 18-footer, Pat Carroll hit a 3-pointer and Barley scored on a fastbreak layup to cut it to 58-54 with 7:34 left. After a free threw by West, Barley hit a 3-pointer and Carroll got a layup after a steal to tie it at 59.
